data: Admit to Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) - See ANES Multi-Modal Pain Management PowerPlan

Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS Depressants, and other analgesics unless approved by the Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology (EXCEPT in Critical Care Units: CSICU and ICU)
Epidural/perineural contraindicated if dose exceeds: enoxaparin 40 mg daily or dalteparin 5000 units daily or heparin 5000 units q8h
For patients receiving prophylactic subcutaneous enoxaparin up to 40 mg qdaily or dalteparin up to 5000 units qdaily or heparin up to 5000 units Q8H
Remove perineural catheter as per protocol
Monitoring Orders are for Inpatient Ward
q1h until pain is well controlled and patient understands therapy then q4h
Assess for systemic side effects of local anesthetic q4h while awake
q15min for 30 minute or until stable then resume as previously ordered
